benchmark_details.name: m-KAILIN (Multi-agent enhanced Knowledge hier Archy gu Ided biomedical dataset disti LlatIoN)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a knowledge-driven, multi-agent framework for scientific corpus distillation tailored to biomedical large language model training. It leverages collaborative agents guided by biomedical ontologies to autonomously generate, evaluate, and refine high-quality question-answer pairs from scientific literature for improved biomedical LLM performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the training of biomedical large language models through an innovative framework for automated dataset generation.

data.source: Generated from over 23 million biomedical research articles using a multi-agent framework.

methodology.calculation: Evaluates model performance on question-answer pairs generated by the framework against baseline models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better alignment with biomedical knowledge and more effective corpus distillation.
methodology.baseline_results: Models trained with m-KAILIN outperformed several large-scale biomedical LLMs.
methodology.validation: Extensive experimental results validating the framework's effectiveness and component contributions.
